tableId.description: The unique identifier for this entry in the meta.json table. Value must come from lib.nextId() to ensure uniqueness

table.description: Contains basic information about the table we are generating code to handle

tableName.description: Name of the table for which we are generating code to handle.

directory.description: Path of folder where the table for which we are generating code will reside.

addRoutes.description: Signals if routes and dependencies should be added to server.js for the code we are generating on behalf of the table defined above.

fields.description: Metadata here specifies how to generate code to handle fields in the table for which we are generating code.

newField.description: Name of a field in the table for which we are generating code.

unique.description: Specifies if values entered into newField must be unique. Make true for foreign key fields

defaultElements.description: Specifies form elements used to populate newField with data for the record in the table for which we are generating code.

parentField.description: This value must match the name of the parent field in order for the code generator to function.

labelText.description: This is the label that will be seen on all forms if not overridden by specifications further down in this form.

elementType.description: Specifies the default control that will be used on the generated webpages to aquire user input. These may be overridden by specifications further down in this form.

attributes.description: Specifies HTML attributes of form elements used to populate newField with data for the record in the table for which we are generating code.

type.description: Normally to specify the type of input.

validation.description: Specifies validation code to be run against data from defaultElement when passed from client to server.

default.description: The key names the code snippet held in the value. Populate the value with the code snippet using a different JSON editor because the new line character is not accepted here.

post.description: Post overrides default. The key names the code snippet held in the value. Populate the value with the code snippet using a different JSON editor because the new line character is not accepted here.

put.description: Put overrides default. The key names the code snippet held in the value. Populate the value with the code snippet using a different JSON editor because the new line character is not accepted here.

get.description: Get overrides default. The key names the code snippet held in the value. Populate the value with the code snippet using a different JSON editor because the new line character is not accepted here.

calculation.description: Specifies calculations used on defaultElements to produce data for newField. Like hashing a user supplied password and saving the hashed password

putHandlerPreprocessing.description: Code that runs in put handler before writing newField to the database. The key names the code snippet held in the value. Populate the value with the code snippet using a different JSON editor because the new line character is not accepted here.

postHandlerPreprocessing.description: Code that runs in post handler before writing newField to the database. The key names the code snippet held in the value. Populate the value with the code snippet using a different JSON editor because the new line character is not accepted here.

apiHandlers.description: metadata describes how to generate code for apiHandlers if there are any special considerations.

pageHandlers.description: metadata describes how to generate code for pageHandlers if there are any special considerations.

webPages.description: metadata describes how to generate webpages and supporting code for interacting with the table for which we are generating code

timeStamp.description: This field tells when a record in metadata.json has been created. Value should be provided by Date.now()

deleted.description: This field tells if a record in metadata.json has been deleted.
